ngoList.title: Vikas Bharthi
ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: The organization was started with a mission to make women lives to be better and empower women to achieve self respect and self reliance, especially in the Indian context. Most of the Indian women are facing ill treatment from the home to work place and all other platforms. Thus the organization with a view to empower women and started by the women and working for the women, especially in rural and semi urban areas, where the female literacy is very low and female participation and decision making also very low. The organization started for a collective effort with a legal back up to take up the activities for the women in the year 1997 by seven similar visionary women and the same team are continuing till date. Major Activities of the Organization The organization is working for the women in the rural and semi urban areas of Chittoor district of Andhra Pradesh in India. The major role of the organization is to empower women through economic, social and political processes. Awareness creation, collective action, microfinance, skill building, natural resource management, promotion of SHGs and health care are the major activities of the organization. Besides, to promote women participation in the decision making in the family and elsewhere are also concern of the organization. The organization is taking every avenue to promote women self respect which leads to self reliance. The organization is taking care of the women participation in natural resource management, especially with the traditional and indigenous medicinal plants where Indian women are well versed with contextual knowledge. Thus, we promoted medicinal plants by some of the women which is giving good impact on the fronts of health aspects of women. We are also providing skill based trainings such as tailoring, agarbathi making, arya work to upgrade as well as to learn market oriented skills among the women to accept income generating activities. Besides, we are promoting entrepreneur skills as well as money management skills for those women who are accepting income generating activities. We are facilitating with the formal financial institutions such as banks for financial linkage to the SHGs to promote financial resources to start any income generating activity. The following are the three major activities : 1. Promotion of Self Help Groups with women to promote collective action. So far we promoted 60 SHGs and trained to exert the collective action in S.R.Puram, Katika Palli, Oddupalli, Gangammagudi and Pilligundla Palli villages of S.R.Puram and Veduru Kuppam mandals of Chittor district, A.P. The groups also include minorities like muslims and disabled. 2. Provided skill based trainings to promote income generation activities among the women, as the economic empowerment is one of the critical step in the empowerment process. Thus, with the support from CAPART, Govt. of India the organization conducted computer literacy program, tailoring, arya work (designer sarees â€“womenâ€™s wear), agarbathi making for self employment of the women and to get rid of economic dependency. Awareness is one of the critical issues for the well being of women on health fronts. Thus, especially on HIV/AIDS the organization organized women health camps and awareness camps to enlighten around 1200 women. This initiative promoted better health status among the women and it also sensitizes on the way to lead by the women. The camps are also focused on adolescent girls, either in the school or out of school.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Visishta Gramodaya Swayam â€œSadhanaâ€ Parishad is a non-Profit, Non-political and Secular, Voluntary Youth Service Organisation, simply called as â€œSADHANAâ€ which abbreviates Society for Action & Development of Human Awareness for National Advancement. â€œSADHANAâ€ is the given shape and spirit of the efforts of a few â€˜Educated like minded youthâ€™, particularly, well trained and service rendered as National Service Volunteers (NSV) under Nehru Yuva Kendra (NYK) (Min. of H.R.D., Dept. of Youth Affairs, Govt. of India) at Visakhaptnam, and belongs to weaker sections and Daliths with blessings of the local elders to make awareness and bring socio-economical and integrated development among the marginalised Urban/Rural mass, particularly the Dalith, Poor, Backward, oppressed and exploited youth and women. It was established in 1989 and got registered in the year 1990, under Indian Societies Registration Act., 1860. Approved by F.C.R.A. from Min. of Home Affairs and got exemption under 12 (A) & 80 (G) of IT Act, Government of India. MISSION: â€œEmpowering the local Community to be Self-Reliant in Reconstruction of their lives for leading a prosperous life with mutual support and self-initiated good governanceâ€. STRATEGY : â€œSADHANAâ€ believes that the only Educational Empowerment leads the Nation towards the sustainable development from grass roots level and it should be owned by the community. Achievements: National Youth Award in reorganization of the outstanding voluntary work rendered in the field of rural development, national integration and social service. Organized women welfare and child development through establishment of women mutually aided thrift and co-op society with 3600 members and 500 SHGs. Taken up NFE project from 1992-2002 with the support from Min. of HRD and literate around 5000 children bellow the age of 9-14. Taken up National Child Labour Project under Min. of labour govt. of India in collaboration with district Bala karmika vidya vikasa society and organized 6 special schools with 300 strength per year for 9 years i.e 1995-2004 and from 2006-08. And get educated with special rehabitation package for about 1600 child laborers. Organized coastal fisher folk communities from Bheemunipatnam to payakaraopeta mandals through Keratam Network supported by Action-aid India over 63 villages of 9 coastal mandals in visakhapatnam district with 1 lakh population. Organizing Andhra Pradesh Community Based Tank Management Programme towards water users association strengthening and water sheds management in collaboration with dept. of irrigation and CADA govt. of A.P. supported by World Bank. Organized Tribal welfare activities thorough PEARL project i.e. people empowerment and access to right to livelihood in of 856 Tribal families of 20 villages in 2 panchayats of Hukumpeta mandal of Paderu division. Working towards capacity building and institutionalization nodal agencies for NGOs and CBOs networks. Affiliated and closely associated with Nehru Yuva Kendra, Andhra University, state and central govt. and non-govt. supported agencies towards development of sustainable agriculture, disabled welfare, community forest management etc. Organized medical and health services towards family welfare, Eye care, women and child health, HIV-Aids and organized integrated water, sanitation and hygiene education project for 10 years supported by Wateraid-UK.

OrganiseRegular workshops for village chilren on all sundays and holidays.Short term wrokshops for 5-6 dayds for preparing graphics/paintings for participation at national and international exhibitions-about 30 in a year.Organising an exhibition of art for children and youth at national/international level and encouraging them with awards.Publication of Art Drive a quarterly magazine for children on art events.Organising Bapu Darshan the mobile exhibition of paintings of the life and philosophy of Mahatma Gandhi in different schools and organising workshops at every school. Students who attend the classes and wrkshops of our Rural art centre have won International an national awards. They own awards from Poland, Japan,Purtugal,China, Egypy,Macedonia,slovakia,Belarus,Turkey and own top awards like Golden brush, golden horse, golden pallettte and hunderds of diplomas.
